titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Carl Gershman papers, 1961-1984
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Dale Reed and Emilia Schrier

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-12-09T11:09-0800

change.item: Incremental materials (boxes 15-31) processed and described by Emilia Schrier.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Elizabeth Phillips.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Carl Gershman Papers)//EN" "gershmac.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, minutes, resolutions, and printed matter relating to the U.S. Mission to the U.N., socialist and radical movements in the U.S., and Social Democrats, U.S.A.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Carl Gershman papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1981, with incremental material received later.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Graduated with a B.A. from Yale University
Volunteered as a Service to America (VISTA) worker, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Graduated with an M.Ed., Harvard University
Director of Research, Co-Chairman, and Executive Director, successively, of the Youth Committee for Peace and Democracy in the Middle East
Vice Chairman, Co-Chairman, and Chairman, successively, of the Young People's Socialist League
Director for the Youth Institute for Peace in the Middle East
Counselor to the U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations
President of the National Endowment for Democracy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches and writings, minutes, resolutions, and printed matter relating to the U.S. Mission to the U.N., socialist, radical, and labor movements in the U.S., the Young People’s Socialist League, and Social Democrats, U.S.A. Includes an audio recording of a debate between Carl Gershman and M. Stanton Evans.

controlaccess.corpname: Young People's Socialist League of America.
controlaccess.subject: Radicalism--United States.
Socialism--United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, printed matter, letters, and miscellany relating to the career of Carl Gershman, unarranged.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript or printed copies of speeches and writings by Carl Gershman, arranged alphabetically by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reel-to-reel recording of Carl Gershman debating M. Stanton Evans on capitalism, socialism, and democracy on April 5, 1979.
